title: What is the average IQ of a musician (classical)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on who you ask. If you ask ten classical musicians, you’ll get a dozen different answers. But the patterns are consistent, with one exception we’ll come to in a minute. Generally, musicians will tell you that people who play the same type of instrument they do are all geniuses. Then the list goes downhill from there. Usually the second tier is instruments of a similar group, (strings, woodwinds, etc.). After that it varies, but near the bottom of the list are vocalists or percussionists, for some reason. Unless you ask a vocalist or percussionist. But at the absolute bottom—and this is sole point of agreement—are conductors. Now we come to the exception, which as you’ve probably figured out already, is conductors. They’ll tell you that all musicians, of any type, are dumber than a bag of used kitty litter. And that includes conductors. Except themselves, of course.

IQ tests are flawed and don’t reflect intellect but experience. That is hardly fair. They were first devised for children but where hijacked to impose sterilization on people who couldn’t pass them. What? You don’t know what a sternocleidomastoid is? YOU’RE STERILIZED. U.S. Eugenics: When a Low I.Q. Meant Sterilization Thousands Sterilized, North Carolina Weighs Restitution
